subject.geographic: First District Court of New Orleans
First District Court of New Orleans

mods.abstract: FIFTY DOLLARS REWARD--RANA-way on the 13th of January, the slave boy FREDERICK, aged about 23 years, black color, about 5 feet 8 inches high, speaks French and English, has an upper front tooth missing; had on cottonade pantaloons, a black frock coat and blue cloth cap. Twenty-five dollars will be paid for the arrest and delivery of said slave at the Police Jail, and Twenty-five dollars more will be paid upon the conviction of the person or persons harboring him. N. TREPAGNIER, First District Court of New Orleans. fe24 tf
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
